title: Senior Survey Specialist
description:
Join to apply for the Senior Survey Specialist role at McDermott International, Ltd

2 days ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the Senior Survey Specialist role at McDermott International, Ltd

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

Job Overview:

The Senior Survey Specialist uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external issues to improve the Survey (Mar) discipline within McDermott. They will act as a resource for colleagues with less experience and share their conceptual and practical expertise related to the Survey (Mar) discipline. The Senior Survey Specialist solves complex problems and uses discipline-specific knowledge to improve their products or services. The Senior Survey Specialist impacts a range of customer, operational, project, or service activities with the Survey (Mar) team and other related teams and ensures they work within the appropriate guidelines and policies.

Job Description

Job Overview:

The Senior Survey Specialist uses best practices and knowledge of internal or external issues to improve the Survey (Mar) discipline within McDermott. They will act as a resource for colleagues with less experience and share their conceptual and practical expertise related to the Survey (Mar) discipline. The Senior Survey Specialist solves complex problems and uses discipline-specific knowledge to improve their products or services. The Senior Survey Specialist impacts a range of customer, operational, project, or service activities with the Survey (Mar) team and other related teams and ensures they work within the appropriate guidelines and policies.

Responsibilities

Key Tasks and Responsibilities:

  • Conduct precise and comprehensive land and marine surveys, ensuring adherence to industry standards and regulations
  • Lead and oversee all survey activities within the EPCI (Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Installation) projects, providing expert guidance and support to the project team
  • Utilize advanced surveying equipment, software, and techniques to accurately collect and analyze marine and land survey data, including bathymetry, geophysical data, and subsea infrastructure
  • Collaborate closely with project managers, engineers, and clients to define survey requirements, objectives, and deliverables for each project phase
  • Plan, organize, and execute survey operations, such as pre-installation surveys, subsea positioning, route surveys, and as-laid/as-built surveys while ensuring compliance with project specifications
  • Manage and interpret survey data and prepare detailed reports, charts, and visual representations, highlighting findings, anomalies, and potential obstacles
  • Conduct quality control checks on all survey data, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and integrity throughout the project lifecycle
  • Develop and maintain survey documentation, and survey equipment readiness, manage and coordinate survey-related contractors or business partners
  • Abreast with the latest advancements in land and marine survey technologies, methodologies, and regulations, and propose innovative solutions to enhance efficiency and accuracy
  • Mentor and train junior survey team members, fostering their professional growth and ensuring adherence to best practices and safety protocols
  • To be based at worksite based on project requirements, onshore and/or offshore

Qualifications

Essential Qualifications and Education:

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Land or Hydrography Survey, Marine Science, Geomatics, or a related field
  • Minimum of 7 years of experience in land and marine surveying within the EPCI industry, with a proven track record of successfully delivering complex projects
  • Strong knowledge of relevant industry regulations, standards, and guidelines e.g., IMCA and/or International Hydrographic Organization (IHO) standards, Marine Spatial Planning (MSP), and Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) practices
  • Proficient in using industry-standard survey equipment and software, including GPS, GNSS, Single/Multibeam Echosounders, various survey sensors, geophysical survey equipment, and new tech photogrammetry and scanning surveying techniques
  • Familiar with Mapping software like AutoCAD, Global Mapper, GIS, tidal and bathymetry software
  • In-depth knowledge of land marine survey methodologies using ROVs and Installation Vessels, data processing, and quality/safety control techniques
  • Strong understanding of subsea infrastructure, offshore construction, and installation processes
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, clients, and stakeholders
  • Detail-oriented and analytical mindset, with a high level of accuracy and precision in survey data analysis and reporting
  • Up-to-date certifications in relevant surveying technologies (e.g., Land and Hydrographic Surveying, Subsea Positioning) are an added advantage
  • A proactive and curious attitude, continuously seeking improvement and innovation in land and marine survey practices
  • Ability to work in challenging onshore and offshore environments and adapt to variable working conditions and schedules

About Us

Our ingenuity fuels daily life. Together, we’ve forged some of the most trusted partnerships across the energy value chain to make what was once just an idea a reality: laying subsea infrastructure thousands of feet below sea level, installing platforms hundreds of miles from shore, using our expertise to design and build offshore wind infrastructure, and reshaping the onshore landscape to deliver the energy products the world needs safely and sustainably.

For more than 100 years, we've been making the impossible possible. Today, we're driving the energy transition with more than 30,000 of the brightest minds across 54 countries.

Responsabilidades e atribuições

  • Treinamento e Educação: Conduzir treinamentos de segurança para os trabalhadores, abordando questões específicas relacionadas ao manuseio seguro de concreto, uso de equipamentos de proteção individual (EPIs) e procedimentos de emergência.
  • Monitoramento de Condições de Trabalho: Monitorar as condições de trabalho em relação à exposição a substâncias perigosas..
  • Investigação de Acidentes: Investigar acidentes e incidentes de segurança que ocorrem durante o trabalho com concreto, identificando suas causas e propondo medidas preventivas para evitar sua recorrência.
  • Avaliação de Equipamentos de Proteção: Avaliar a eficácia dos equipamentos de proteção individual e coletiva utilizados pelos trabalhadores e fazer recomendações para melhorias, se necessário.
  • Acompanhamento de Legislação e Normas Técnicas: Manter-se atualizado sobre as regulamentações e normas técnicas relacionadas à segurança no trabalho, especialmente aquelas específicas para o manuseio de concreto.
  • Assessoria Técnica: Prestar assessoria técnica aos gestores e trabalhadores sobre questões de segurança relacionadas ao trabalho com concreto, oferecendo orientações e soluções para garantir um ambiente de trabalho seguro.


Requisitos e qualificações

  • Curso de Técnico de Segurança do Trabalho Completo;
  • Experiência comprovada na área;
  • Vivência em construção civil (CANTEIRO DE OBRAS);
  • Ser proativo, dinâmico, ter muita vontade e disposição para somar ao nosso time.


Informações adicionais

  • Plano de Saúde;
  • Plano Odontológico;
  • Alimentação no local;
  • Vale Transporte;
  • Day Off;
  • Seguro de Vida;
  • Convênio com Faculdades;

title: Assistente de Logística
description:
Descrição

Responsável por apoiar a execução das rotinas logísticas operacionais e administrativas, assegurando o correto fluxo de informações e documentos entre operadores logísticos, transportadoras, armazéns, clientes e áreas internas. O assistente será peça fundamental no controle de movimentações, no suporte às operações em outros estados e na garantia da acuracidade dos processos.

Descrição

Responsável por apoiar a execução das rotinas logísticas operacionais e administrativas, assegurando o correto fluxo de informações e documentos entre operadores logísticos, transportadoras, armazéns, clientes e áreas internas. O assistente será peça fundamental no controle de movimentações, no suporte às operações em outros estados e na garantia da acuracidade dos processos.

Principais Atividades

Conferência de faturas de armazenagem com base em contratos, tabelas logísticas e movimentações reais;

Lançamento de Notas Fiscais de entrada e saída no sistema ERP da companhia;

Emissão de NF, quando necessário, em apoio à área;

Controle e acompanhamento de entrada e saída de produtos em armazéns terceirizados, garantindo rastreabilidade, acompanhamento das não conformidades e follow up junto aos armazéns;

Atualização de planilhas de controle logístico e KPIs, como tempo de carregamento, tempo de armazenagem, volume movimentado, estimativas de custos;

Suporte na gestão de contratos de operadores logísticos e prestadores de serviço;

Acompanhamento de SLA’s operacionais;

Suporte em auditorias logísticas e inventários físicos periódicos;

Interface constante com times de comércio exterior, planejamento de demanda, fiscal, financeiro e vendas, garantindo alinhamento nos processos;

Controle do estoque de embalagens, apontamento de necessidade de compra com antecedência, realização de ordens de produção no sistema;

Acompanhamento dos estoques avariados e de falta;

Apoio na gestão documental de armazenagem, mantendo os arquivos atualizados e auditáveis.

  • Que Buscamos

Ensino Técnico em Logística, Administração, Comércio Exterior ou áreas correlatas (completo);

Excel intermediário a avançado;

ERP (preferencialmente TOTVS);

Familiaridade com documentos fiscais e logísticos (NF, faturas de armazenagem);

Noções de legislação fiscal básica aplicada a logística (CFOP);

Desejável conhecimento em Power BI;

Desejável curso superior em Logística, Administração, Engenharia ou áreas afins;

Desejável conhecimento em inglês.

Venha fazer parte do nosso time!

Idiomas

Inglês - Nível Intermediário

title: Senior Sap Ewm
description:
Join or sign in to find your next job

Join to apply for the Senior SAP EWM role at Decskill

1 day ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, with a main mission to deliver value through knowledge.

We enable companies to meet the challenges of the digital world by providing business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility, and agility.

We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid.

DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas
  • DECSKILL TALENT : providing clients with an extension to their IT teams;
  • DECSKILL BOOST : offering software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, creating and managing teams that deliver according to client needs;
  • DECSKILL CONNECT : providing consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of IT infrastructures.

Our practice creates value for customers by delivering qualified, value-added services, highly qualified professionals, and technology solutions that transform business.

We are seeking a SAP EWM Expert for a remote project in Brazil.

Roles and Responsibilities
  • End-to-end implementation of EWM inbound/outbound processing, stock management, physical inventory, replenishment, and scrapping;
  • Apply strong business process knowledge on EWM and integration with modules like Production Planning, Material Management, Quality Management, and SCM;
  • Review warehouse processes and recommend improvements using SAP S/4HANA, conducting fit-gap analysis;
  • Implement Yard Management, Transportation planning, and Cross Docking in Warehouse Management;
  • Handle production supply, slotting, and rearrangement;
  • Manage replenishment processing and cartonization planning;
  • Work with SAP Fiori apps and workflows.
Required Qualifications
  • 8+ years of SAP EWM experience;
  • Solid experience with SAP EWM integration with S/4HANA, Goods Issue and GR, Yard and Resource Management, and SAP Value Added Services;
  • Experience with SAP S/4HANA implementation;
  • Experience with SAP Mobile Technologies (e.g., SAP Console, ITS Mobile, RFID) is a plus;
  • Experience with cutover and data migration activities;
  • Hands-on experience with warehouse structure setup, POSC, LOSC, WOC, Wave management, PPF, etc.;
  • Good collaboration skills and ability to work cross-capability with internal and external teams.

If interested, please send your CV in English to ****** with reference "DA/EWM".

Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination, promoting diversity and inclusion regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality, or other forms of discrimination.

title: Pessoa Degustadora - Rio de Janeiro/RJ (Exclusiva para Mulheres)
description:
Essa é uma vaga afirmativa exclusiva para Mulheres.

Na Greenpeople, acreditamos que a diversidade fortalece nossa cultura e potencializa nossos resultados. Essa iniciativa faz parte do nosso compromisso em promover equidade e ampliar a representatividade dos nossos times



Responsável por realizar degustações dos produtos da empresa em pontos de venda (PDVs), promovendo a marca e criando um relacionamento próximo com os consumidores. A atuação inclui apresentar os produtos, coletar feedback dos clientes e contribuir para a fidelização de novos consumidores, sempre mantendo o PDV organizado e atrativo.

Principais Responsabilidades:

  • Realizar degustações: Oferecer degustações dos produtos nos pontos de venda, introduzindo os consumidores aos produtos e incentivando a experimentação.
  • Promover a marca: Engajar consumidores de maneira proativa, aumentando a visibilidade e reforçando a percepção positiva da marca.
  • Coletar feedback : Obter opiniões e impressões dos clientes sobre os produtos degustados, registrando informações relevantes para o time de marketing e produto.
  • Fomentar a fidelização: Estimular a compra e a lealdade dos consumidores, apresentando as vantagens e diferenciais dos produtos.
  • Organização do PDV: Auxiliar na organização e apresentação dos produtos no PDV, mantendo o local atrativo e alinhado com os padrões da empresa.

Requisitos:

  • Experiência prévia em atividades de degustação ou promoção será considerada um diferencial.
  • Habilidades de comunicação para interagir de forma simpática e envolvente com os consumidores.
  • Perfil proativo e dinâmico, com foco em resultados e engajamento do público.
  • Disponibilidade para trabalhar em horários flexíveis, incluindo fins de semana.
  • Atenção aos detalhes para manter o PDV organizado e atrativo.
  • Segundo grau completo

NaGreenpeople, acreditamos na força da diversidade e no valor das diferenças. Todas as nossas vagas são abertas a pessoas de todas as origens, identidades e histórias. Aqui, cada talento importa.

#J-18808-Ljbffr

title: Analista de Planejamento Financeiro - Botafogo
description:
Job description

Somos um Grupoformado por marcas que possuem mais de 45 anos de experiência na área da saúde, e estamos presentes nos estados do Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo, Minas Gerais, Paraná, Espirito Santo e Ceará realizando mais de 456 mil consultas anuais e cuidando da vida de mais de 100 mil pacientes.Nossa identidade foi construída equilibrando ofoco em pessoas com uma gestão eficiente, por isso, valorizamos profissionais que sejam curiosos, acolhedores, que tenham calor humano, que transmitam confiança, mas que também sejam eficientes, ágeis, assertivos, orientados a resultados e processos.

Somos movidos pelo propósito de criar um Brasil ativo e sem dor, transformando relações na saúde, oferecendo um ecossistema de excelência a pacientes com doenças musculoesquelético e de terapia assistida.

Estamos em transformação e buscamos profissionais que queiram fazer parte da nossa história, mas para trabalhar conosco você precisa se reconhecer nos nossos valores:

FOCO NAS PESSOAS

Nossosvalores

Pessoas são o nosso DNA: Somos justos nas relações com os pacientes, colegas de trabalho, parceiros e prestadores de serviço. Incentivamos sonhos e valorizamos as pessoas por suas competências.

Simplificamos para fazer bem feito: Antecipamos os problemas e buscamos realizar as atividades da forma mais eficiente, agindo de imediato e de forma coordenada com foco na solução.

Queremos mais: Buscamos incansavelmente a evolução, valorizando feedbacks e nos preocupando em sempre entregar a melhor experiência.

Empoderamos as pessoas: Somos proativos para solucionar problemas e buscar oportunidades, assumimos responsabilidade pelas atividades exercidas, sem transferi-la para outros.

Se você quer fazer a diferença, achou o lugar certo!

Venha fazer história com a gente!

#SomosVitus #PorUmaVidaSemDor

  • Relatórios Gerenciais: Preparar relatórios financeiros detalhados e apresentações para a alta gestão.
  • Melhoria de Processos: Identificar oportunidades de melhoria nos processos financeiros e operacionais, com foco em automação/controle e eficiência.

title: Billing Analyst II
description:
About Us

Airswift is the leading workforce solutions provider to the STEM industries. For over 40 years Airswift has been transforming lives through the provision of international workforce solutions to STEM industries. Today, we are an integrated team of over 900 employees across 37 countries, supporting over 8,000 contractors globally.

We are a people business – we transform lives through the world of work. We care about wellbeing, community engagement and our planet – we plant a tree for every person placed in a job globally! We have a passion for growth, including investing in the development of our people.

We support professionals looking for jobs with exceptional firms in the technology, construction, and engineering sectors.

It's a hybrid schedule (3 days at the office per week) in Rio de Janeiro - Cinelândia.

Role Description

The Billing Analyst will have responsibility for specificclient accounts in Airswift's sales ledger covering the North American region. You will join a strong team based in our Rio de Janeiro office and will be tasked with ensuring fully compliant and timely billing for clients under your remit.

Principle Accountabilities:

  • Assure billing for the assigned client portfolio.
  • Adhere to client billing requirements as per contracts and work orders, call off orders, purchase orders, etc.
  • Liaise closely with consultants on new clients and new client billing requirements.
  • Ensure accuracy and completeness of billing, including recharges to clients.
  • Ensure timely delivery of invoices to clientsalong with a variety of supporting documentation.
  • Ensure reporting to the Supervisor of any un-invoiced, missed, or incorrect amount that is not billed timely manner to the client or becomes aged.
  • Ensure timely response to clients (external and internal) and report to the direct Supervisor of specific customer requests for timely delivery.
  • Report on funded invoices to the billing supervisor accurately and in a timely fashion.
  • Deliver pro forma invoicing, pre-approvals, SES, etc.
  • Ensure all banking information is correct on invoices as per funded or non-funded category, currency, and billing entity.
  • Follow up on invoices emailed to clientsor via consultantsto confirm receipt.
  • Reconcile client VMS (vendor management system) with an internal invoicing system to ensure invoices are correctly submitted.
  • Monitor the status of invoices that were previously sent by email, portal, or VMS systems for any rejections that require correction.
  • Ensure intercompany invoices are issued correctly and timely manner between Airswift's legal entities.
  • Work to the month-end deadlines.
  • Compare invoices from Tempest (payroll and billing system) to invoices generated in Amalto to ensureall relevant information has been saved in SharePoint and maintainedin line with auditing requirements.
  • Import invoices to Dynamics 365 (financial ERP system), and balance payroll and billing Tempest to D365, ensuring all billing has been captured.
  • Complete submittal logs in a timely fashion and attend weekly submittal meetings with the Billing Supervisor.
  • Ensure all invoices and backups are filed in a shared drive and maintained.
  • Complete queries in a 48-hour turnaround (outside of main invoicing schedules) and maintain and complete query log.
  • Liaise with payroll to validate any payroll adjustments affected by credit notes and complete credit note logs for auditing purposes.
  • Review new client contracts with the Billing Supervisor to ensure all requirements are captured.
  • Ensure Bullhorn (client management system) data is correct and highlight errors to consultants and service teams accordingly.
  • Meet accuracy targets in line with KPIS.
  • Purchase orderand work orderanalysis.
  • Maintain and deliver 3rd party reconciliations and advise the billing supervisor of details to pay – this is working with credit control to ascertain paid invoices (pay when paid basis).
  • Communicate with various parties of the PO analysis ceilings to ensure timely delivery of either renewed PO value or extended PO.
  • Support function for MIDE region invoicingas and when required.
  • Be fully involved in working with credit control to reduce DSO and improve the liquidity of Airswift for the North American region.
  • Follow company policies and procedures, guidelines, and standards.
  • Ad hoc duties as and when required.

Skills, Knowledge, and Experience:

  • 2+ years of experience in billing
  • Knowledge of multi-currency transactions.
  • Knowledge of VAT and WHT is beneficial.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Good communication skills.
  • Ability to work in a challenging environment with the abilityto meet deadlines and adapt to changing priorities.
  • Experience in liaising with various internal departments.
  • Focused and dedicated mindset.
  • Good team player with the ability to drive changes and improvements.
  • Knowledge of funding and non-funding.
  • Knowledge of withholding tax (training provided).
  • Excel and Word knowledge are preferred, but training will be given.

What we can offer you!

  • Attractive monthly base salary + competitive commission/performance bonus.
  • Genuine career progression opportunities, either locally or globally!
  • World-class training programmes and development opportunities.
  • Virtual Onboarding Events exclusively for new hires.
  • Team driven environment, supportive culture with a focus on work-life balance.
  • Career breaks available after one year.
  • Real time recognition through our employee reward platform.
  • Mental Health First Aiders to signpost you to support when you need it.
  • Yearly destination trips as part of our High Flyers program (Dubai, Buenos Aires, etc…)
  • Charity days for various important causes such as Relay for Life and Earth Day.
Our Core Values:
  • Growth - In life and business, one must grow to flourish and achieve high ambitions. Growthrequires change, challenge, risk and sacrifice - we will always choose growth.
  • Life – Above all else, we value life. The quality of life, both in and outside of work, profoundly influences our well-being and our impact on the world.
  • Excellence - We deliver, holding ourselves accountable for results. Our customers see excellence in everything we do.
  • Integrity - We are ethical, open, honest and authentic. People trust us to do the right thing for the right reason.
Visit our website and social media to find out more! - />
Disclaimer
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

Diversity & Inclusion
At Airswift, we believe that diversity is critical to our success and makes us a great place to work. We are committed to building an equal opportunity workplace, the more inclusive we are - the better our work will be.

Nosso dia a dia é movido por uma cultura inspiradora e inclusiva, que busca a equidade e valoriza as diferenças. Por isso, buscamos pessoas cada vez mais diversas e inovadoras para fazer parte desse propósito!

Aqui, temos as melhores pessoas e todas se unem pelo mesmo propósito: transformar a educação mundial através da tecnologia e democratização de acesso.

Job description

Somos um Grupoformado por marcas que possuem mais de 45 anos de experiência na área da saúde, e estamos presentes nos estados do Rio de Janeiro e São Paulo realizando mais de 120 mil consultas anuais e cuidando da vida de mais de 40 mil pacientes.Nossa identidade foi construída equilibrando ofoco em pessoas com uma gestão eficiente, por isso, valorizamos profissionais que sejam curiosos, acolhedores, que tenham calor humano, que transmitam confiança, mas que também sejam eficientes, ágeis, assertivos, orientados a resultados e processos.

Somos movidos pelo propósito de criar um Brasil ativo e sem dor, transformando relações na saúde, oferecendo um ecossistema de excelência no tratamento musculoesquelético.

Para se identificar conosco você precisa se reconhecer nos nossos valores:

Somos uma empresa que está em transformação e buscamos profissionais que queiram fazer parte da história desta empresa que é referência no tratamento a pacientes com doenças musculo esquelético e terapia assistida.

Se você quer fazer a diferença, achou o lugar certo!

Venha fazer história com a gente!

  • Manutenção e limpeza

  • Administrativo
  • Autorização
  • Faturamento
  • Financeiro
  • TI

  • Aqui ninguém é empregado de ninguém. O ambiente é o mais horizontal possível, possibilitando a sua autonomia para tomar as melhores decisões para as atividades pelas quais você é responsável. Não espere pelos outros aquilo que você pode fazer por si mesmo.

Se você quer crescer em um ambiente acelerado, com liberdade para criar e impacto direto no negócio, essa vaga é pra você!

Como Analista de Recursos Humanos , sua missão será: Atuar diretamente nos pilares de Recrutamento, Clima e Cultura , sendo peça-chave na atração, desenvolvimento e retenção dos talentos que vão acelerar o crescimento da V4. Você será protagonista na construção de um RH estratégico e data-driven, dominando processos, ferramentas e metodologias da V4 enquanto amplia sua visão analítica e de negócio.

Principais responsabilidades:

Diferenciais:

  • Conhecimento em metodologias ágeis aplicadas a RH;
  • Formação em Psicologia, Administração, Gestão de RH ou áreas correlatas;
  • Certificações em ferramentas de assessment e perfis comportamentais.

O que oferecemos:
  • Os benefícios serão informados pela recrutadora.
  • Acesso aos cursos da Staage.

  • Ambiente dinâmico e colaborativo.

  • Desenvolvimento contínuo e aprendizado constante.
  • Gestão meritocrática.
  • Possibilidade de sociedade baseada no desempenho e alinhamento cultural com o negócio.

title: Bombeiro hidraulico
description:
Netvagas Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

Netvagas Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

  • Smart Hospital: Transformando a saúde com inovação. Somos líderes em construção, reforma e operação de infraestrutura hospitalar, pioneiros em modernizar hospitais por meio de parcerias público-privadas. Em parceria com o Complexo Hospitalar Souza Aguiar, o maior hospital de emergência da América Latina, estamos redefinindo os padrões de atendimento em saúde.

Quem somos?

  • Smart Hospital: Transformando a saúde com inovação. Somos líderes em construção, reforma e operação de infraestrutura hospitalar, pioneiros em modernizar hospitais por meio de parcerias público-privadas. Em parceria com o Complexo Hospitalar Souza Aguiar, o maior hospital de emergência da América Latina, estamos redefinindo os padrões de atendimento em saúde.

O que buscamos?

Um profissional experiente e dedicado para integrar nossa equipe como Bombeiro Hidráulico com Experiência em Obras Hospitalares. O profissional será responsável pela instalação, manutenção e reparo de sistemas hidráulicos, sanitários, de gases medicinais e outras tubulações em nossos projetos de construção e reforma de unidades hospitalares, garantindo o funcionamento seguro e eficiente das instalações.

Dia a Dia

  • Interpretação de projetos hidráulicos, sanitários e de gases medicinais.
  • Instalação de tubulações de diferentes materiais (PVC, CPVC, PPR, cobre, aço carbono, etc.) para água fria, água quente, esgoto sanitário, ventilação, gases medicinais (oxigênio, ar comprimido, vácuo, etc.) e outras instalações específicas de hospitais.
  • Montagem e instalação de conexões, válvulas, registros, bombas, sifões e outros acessórios hidráulicos e sanitários.
  • Instalação de aparelhos sanitários (vasos, pias, lavatórios, chuveiros, etc.) e equipamentos hospitalares que dependem de conexões hidráulicas e de gases.
  • Execução de testes de pressão e vazamento nas instalações para garantir a estanqueidade e o correto funcionamento.
  • Identificação e correção de vazamentos, obstruções e outros problemas em sistemas hidráulicos e sanitários existentes.
  • Realização de manutenção preventiva e corretiva em instalações hidráulicas, sanitárias e de gases. Instalação de sistemas de combate a incêndio (sprinklers, hidrantes) conforme projeto.
  • Colaboração com outros profissionais da obra (engenheiros, mestres de obra, outros encanadores, etc.).

Local de atuação: Complexo Hospitalar Municipal Souza Aguiar | Endereço: Praça da República, 111, Centro, Rio de Janeiro

Horário: 7h as 17h de segunda a quinta-feira | 7h as 16h na sexta-feira.

Requisitos

O que precisamos que você tenha:

  • Experiência comprovada como Bombeiro Hidráulico.
  • Conhecimento em leitura e interpretação de projetos hidráulicos, sanitários e de gases medicinais.
  • Habilidade na instalação de tubulações de diferentes materiais e diâmetros.
  • Conhecimento de normas técnicas e regulamentações aplicáveis a instalações hidráulicas, sanitárias e de gases medicinais em hospitais.
  • Capacidade de trabalhar em equipe e seguir orientações.
  • Atenção aos detalhes e compromisso com a qualidade do serviço.

O Que Vamos Amar Se Você Tiver

  • Curso profissionalizante na área de hidráulica e saneamento.
  • Certificações específicas para instalação de gases medicinais.
  • Conhecimento em sistemas de tratamento de água e efluentes hospitalares.
  • Experiência com soldagem de tubulações de cobre e aço carbono.
  • Proatividade e capacidade de solucionar problemas.

Benefícios

Benefícios

  • Mobilidade: Cartão Swile com VT (combo mobilidade) para você escolher a melhor forma de chegar ao trabalho.
  • Alimentação: VA/VR (R$ 25,00/dia) com a flexibilidade de um cartão de crédito, para você escolher onde e como se alimentar.
  • Saúde: Plano de saúde, programa Vittude de saúde mental, plano odontológico e Totalpass para cuidar do seu bem-estar físico e mental.
  • Finanças: Descontos diferenciados em folha de pagamento.
  • Day off no aniversário: Proporcionando um dia de descanso para comemorar seu aniversário.
  • Convênio com SESC: Oferece acesso a diversas atividades de lazer e cultura, promovendo a qualidade de vida pra você e sua família.
  • Seguro de vida: Garante a segurança financeira da sua família em caso de imprevistos, proporcionando tranquilidade e proteção.

title: Technology Value Realization Specialist
description:
Join to apply for the Technology Value Realization Specialist role at aramco

6 days ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the Technology Value Realization Specialist role at aramco

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

Candidates must relocate to Saudi Arabia.

Aramco energizes the world economy.

Aramco occupies a special position in the global energy industry. We are one of the world’s largest producers of hydrocarbon energy and chemicals, with among the lowest Upstream carbon intensities of any major producer.

With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco’s value to society.

Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations’ spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom’s vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.

We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.

Overview

We are seeking a Technology Value Realization Specialist to join our Technology Strategy & Planning Department (TSPD).

TSPD’s mission is to provide high-impact leadership and support across the technology life-cycle, from strategy setting to value realization and sustainable growth, and partner with corporate and business stakeholders to integrate new technologies into the company’s strategies and investment plans.

Your primary role is to play a central part in the corporate stage-gate and value realization process. You will provide leadership in the implementation, governance and sustainable capability needed to support full integration, application and continuous improvement of the technology stage-gate process.

Key Responsibilities

As the successful candidate you will be required to perform the following:

  • Support the company-wide roll-out of the Technology Realized Value (TRV) KPI validation and reporting process in partnership with Upstream, Downstream, Finance & Technology Organizations.
  • Manage and oversee the technology stage-gate process, including ongoing implementation to support R&D, technology development, demonstration and deployment, and transition to operations in order to enable value realization from technology investments.
  • Provide leadership for scientists, engineers, and other business/functional specialists to enable de-risking and go/no go decisions for R&D projects, ensuring technical-commercial readiness prior to deployment and value realization.
  • Serve as an internal consultant for project teams on the development of robust business cases, deployment and value realization strategies, including partnering with technical, commercial and business leads to implement robust commercial review process to maximize financial return and strategic impact from R&D projects.
  • Assess technology stage-gate practices and related activities across the Company, in order to maintain high-standards and compliance with the Corporate Technology Development General Instructions.
  • Partner with R&D staff and stakeholders in technology, business and supporting functions, in order to ensure alignment across all areas and to support a smooth transition and adoption of the enhanced technology management processes.
  • Provide expert guidance to project teams and technology/executive management on related activities, including business case development, IP and commercial strategy, supply chain development, deployment plans, business models, value realization and related techno-economics.
  • You must hold a Bachelor degree in Science or Engineering. An advanced degree (MBA/Finance) is highly desirable.
  • You should have at least 10 years of professional experience, including at least 5 years of experience in commercial technology development and value realization, preferably with some experience in oil and gas, chemicals and related industries.
  • You must possess subject matter expertise, business acumen and effective change management skills.
  • You will be able to demonstrate experience with Project and Portfolio Management (PPM) systems, such as Planisware, Accolade, Clarity and similar software applications.
  • A proven track record of successfully working with multi-cultural, cross-functional teams, and developing productive working relationships.
  • Experience with Operation Excellence (OE) process development, implementation, including continuous improvement is also required.

Working environment

Our high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.

At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the world’s biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.

We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs – one of the largest in the world.

title: Geoscience Software Customer Success Manager
description:
About The Role

Grade Level (for internal use):

10

S&P Global Commodity Insights

The Role: Geoscience Software Customer Success Manager

The Team

You will be part of the Global Software Customer Success team of S&P Global Commodities Insights. The team helps clients to navigate between sales, product management, customer IT infrastructure and their S&P Global services. We use our expertise to demonstrate the value of our products and market intelligence using integrated workflows.

The Impact

The Geoscience Software Customer Success Manager will provide support for S&P Global geoscience products, specifically Kingdom (seismic and geological interpretation software) via phone, email inquiries and client-facing training sessions. This person will provide help in troubleshooting technical issues and demonstrate the value of the software in collaboration with our data and information. They will work with product management and sustaining engineers to develop processes or product enhancements to address client needs.

What’s In It For You

  • Work with the latest technology in geology and geophysical interpretation and in analytical tools with focus in the upstream business.
  • Opportunity to participate in product design and development.
  • Work in a highly collaborative and passionate team environment
  • Develop your skills for creation and delivery of trainings and high-level workflows
  • Collaborate with a diverse group of colleagues in a dynamic environment. s

Responsibilities

  • Proactively/reactively provide customer training via on-site visits, WebEx, phone or email to incorporate Kingdom into their workflow and drive customer satisfaction and retention.
  • Troubleshoot client issues to determine root cause and provide a reasonable resolution
  • Create and deliver complex workflows in a straightforward and clear manner
  • Provide detailed information for “critical” issues to escalation teams
  • Submit enhancement requests on the client’s behalf if the desired functionality does not currently exist in the software.
  • Maintain healthy relationships with sustaining engineers, product management, and development.

What We’re Looking For

Knowledge and Skills:

  • Able to work as part of a team or independently with moderate supervision
  • Excellent organizational, time and project management skills. Ability to handle multiple projects and priorities in a professional and timely manner
  • Must be articulate, patient, professional, and have strong interpersonal skills
  • Must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Able to quickly learn new software and interfaces
  • Can work within cross-functional teams, running client specific projects related to geological/geophysical data
  • Previous experience working with geoscience software is desirable
  • Excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills in English and Portuguese are a must. Additional languages are an advantage.

Education & Experience (candidates with experience in one, or more, of the following):

  • Bachelor’s degree in Geology, Geophysics or earth science degree. Master's is a plus
  • 5 years’ experience in the E&P industry
  • Experience in troubleshooting technical issues
  • Experience with Kingdom or another geophysical interpretation software
  • Knowledge of Windows operating systems, networking, and internet functionality. Experience using or managing databases (SQL Server, Oracle, or another relational database), Cloud, API, Map Services, BI tools is a plus

About S&P Global Commodity Insights

At S&P Global Commodity Insights, our complete view of global energy and commodities markets enables our customers to make decisions with conviction and create long-term, sustainable value.

We’re a trusted connector that brings together thought leaders, market participants, governments, and regulators to co-create solutions that lead to progress. Vital to navigating Energy Transition, S&P Global Commodity Insights’ coverage includes oil and gas, power, chemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.

S&P Global Commodity Insights is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI). S&P Global is the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks, analytics and workflow solutions in the global capital, commodity and automotive markets. With every one of our offerings, we help many of the world’s leading organizations navigate the economic landscape so they can plan for tomorrow, today.

For more information, visit />
What’s In It For You?

Our Purpose

Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world.

Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress.

Our People

We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.

From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We’re constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.

Our Values

Integrity, Discovery, Partnership

At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.

Benefits

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.

Our Benefits Include

  • Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  • Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  • Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  • Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  • Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
  • Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.

For more information on benefits by country visit: />
Inclusive Hiring And Opportunity At S&P Global

At S&P Global, we are committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals have access to opportunities based on their skills, experience, and contributions. Our hiring practices emphasize fairness, transparency, and equal opportunity, ensuring that we attract and retain top talent. By valuing different perspectives and promoting a culture of respect and collaboration, we drive innovation and power global markets.

Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

A Petronect é o maior marketplace do Brasil em soluções B2B conectando fornecedores, compradores e instituições financeiras ao processo de compras. Provendo serviços de comércio eletrônico relacionados à aquisição de bens e serviços, atuando nas cadeias de suprimentos do setor de petróleo e gás.

title: Senior Contracts Manager
description:
Are you a Contracts Manager who drives customer satisfaction?
Are you looking for your next Senior role?

Join our team!

At Baker Hughes, we are transforming the future of energy. With operations in over 120 countries, we are developing and deploying industry-leading technologies and services to take energy forward. For more than a century, our inventions have revolutionized energy. Today, we are bringing our expertise to make oil and gas safer, cleaner, and more efficient.

Partner with the best

The Senior Contracts Manager will be responsible to manage SP&S deals from a contracting and commercial perspective throughout the deal lifecycle, ensuring compliance with contract commitments and commercial risk assessment during all phases.

In this role they negotiate contract terms and conditions, provide commercial and contractual leadership and direction throughout the entire deal life-cycle and develop practical and innovative ways to identify & mitigate contract risk.

As a Senior Contracts Manager , you will be responsible for:

  • Developing & negotiating detailed contractual agreements with customers, and leading cross-functional teams in the contract negotiation, contributing to define the overall deal strategy.
  • Supporting the bid teams in proposal development, risk management (including deal risk and governance adherence - deal reviews, Deal Machine, etc.), scope definition, pricing and incentives, customer communications and issue resolution.
  • Managing all commercial and contractual related aspects of a project during the execution phase, including but not limited to commercial arrangements, Variation Orders, contract negotiation, amendments, adherence to contract requirements, etc.
  • Ensuring compliance with the project specific contractual administration requirements (establish and maintain the project variation control system, managing the invoicing process, etc..).
  • Providing advice, assistance and guidance to management, project managers, engineering, sourcing and other functions on project specific contractual matters.
  • Ensuring commercial risks are identified and managed across the project scopes of work by controlling the overall project risk and opportunity review and reporting process.
  • Managing negotiations in line with contract requirements, including supporting the formulation and negotiation of project contractual claims and counter claims
  • Change Management.


Fuel your passion

To be successful in this role you will:

  • Have a Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college
  • Be fluent in both English and Portuguese.
  • Have demonstrable experience in Project and Contract Management with execution of large capital projects, within Oil & Gas or Subsea businesses.
  • Have detailed knowledge of energy contracts, terms and conditions and negotiation techniques and contracts negotiation.
  • Strong commercial leadership skills with proven capability of working in a matrix environment and of leading by influence.
  • Understanding of key contractual and commercial risks and areas for opportunity and ability to lead project risk review process and assessments.
  • Negotiating Skills: To secure favorable outcomes, having the flexibility to understand and negotiate alternative contractual and commercial positions with customers (subject to approval).
  • Strong commercial acumen and business understanding
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills in English and Portuguese.
  • Effective Team player.
  • Be willing to travel.


Work in a way that works for you

We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns:

  • Working from a Rio de Janeiro based Baker Hughes office.


Working with us

Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.

Working for you

Our inventions have revolutionized energy for over a century. But to keep going forward tomorrow, we know we have to push the boundaries today. We prioritize rewarding those who embrace change with a package that reflects how much we value their input. Join us, and you can expect:

  • Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
  • Comprehensive private medical care options
  • Safety net of life insurance and disability programs
  • Tailored financial programs
  • Additional elected or voluntary benefits


About Us

With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we're committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we're always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient.

Join Us

Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!

title: Especialista Configurador de Produto Sr
description:
Join to apply for the Especialista Configurador de Produto Sr role at Dover Business Services Europe

3 days ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the Especialista Configurador de Produto Sr role at Dover Business Services Europe

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

Location:

Rio de Janeiro, DF, BR

Dover Fueling Solutions (“DFS”), a Dover company (NYSE: DOV) and comprised of the businesses of ClearView, Fairbanks, ProGauge, Tokheim, Wayne Fueling Systems, and OPW’s Fuel Management Systems, delivers advanced fuel dispensing equipment, electronic systems and payment, automatic tank gauging and wetstock management solutions to customers worldwide. Headquartered in Austin, Texas, DFS has a significant manufacturing presence around the world, including facilities in the USA, the UK, the Netherlands, Sweden, France, India, China, and Brazil.

Lead the configuration team in the development of product implementations in the CPQ-FPX configurator. Meet commercial and operational demands, developing systemic solutions in the configuration tool, aiming to meet the needs of the market and the company's expansion and commercialization.

Responsibilities

  • Prepare and/or change bills of materials and technical specification matrices together with the leaders of each project, aiming to ensure the required specifications and quality standards.
  • Work on implementation plans and design solutions for product configuration, leading the configurator team in the development of interfaces and configuration in logical rules for creating configurable bills of materials.
  • Include/enable products and their options in the CPQ-FPX product configurator, aiming to release the product for sale.
  • Work on preparing the PDM-FPX interface (configurator database management software) and activities related to CPQ with Oracle, regarding the creation of bills of materials and item registration.
  • Coordinate with other Wayne manufacturing facilities on activities related to PDM (Product Data Management software for the configurator database) and CPQ-related tasks.
  • Work collaboratively with the configuration team, balancing workload as needed to meet SLA commitments.
  • Lead RCA (Root Cause Analysis) investigations and manage non-conformity dispositions related to the Bill of Materials.
  • Manage tickets and engineering-related activities in the SharePoint system associated with CPQ-FPX.
  • Perform data and statistical analyses to drive continuous performance improvement for the team.
  • Handle commercial and operations team requests related to system improvements and issue resolutions within CPQ-FPX.
  • Manage KPIs, conducting regular performance reviews with the configuration team to ensure alignment and continuous improvement.
  • Perform other tasks related to your area of activity, at the discretion of your manager.

Skills

  • Demonstrate leadership in communicating business objectives, programs and processes for an area or business segment.
  • Utilize experience or knowledge to solve problems, develop and execute objectives for self and others, and achieve short/medium term and sometimes long-term business goals.
  • Report risks, mitigation, and resolution to management through business segment risk analyses.
  • Implement process improvements to increase organizational efficiency and effectiveness.
  • Play a proactive role in identifying and resolving issues during the project, highlighting potential areas of concern and promptly leading other departments in resolving issues that impact project execution.
  • Ability to work well in cross-functional and cross-cultural teams.
  • Ability to balance workload within tight deadlines and shift priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to deal with ambiguity and handle stressful and difficult situations with composure.
  • Ability to lead a team or project/program.
  • Ability to create, interpret and optimize complex product mathematical and logical rules.
  • Demonstrates a clear understanding of the organizational strategy, sets personal goals aligned with business objectives, and provides market and customer insights to the management team to support strategic planning.

Complementary Information

  • Completed Higher Education: Engineering / Information Science / Information Technology
  • Fluent English
  • Have a deep knowledge of mathematical and logical rules ,Database Management (Database, SQL, Product Configurator), Java programming language syntax and Office package and Oracle ERP system

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, age, genetic information, or any other factors prohibited by law.

title: Backend Engineer (Compliance) ID35382
description:
Join to apply for the Backend Engineer (Compliance) ID35382 role at AgileEngine

4 weeks ago Be among the first 25 applicants

Join to apply for the Backend Engineer (Compliance) ID35382 role at AgileEngine

Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

AgileEngine is an Inc. 5000 company that creates award-winning software for Fortune 500 brands and trailblazing startups across 17+ industries. We rank among the leaders in areas like application development and AI/ML, and our people-first culture has earned us multiple Best Place to Work awards.

If you're looking for a place to grow, make an impact, and work with people who care, we'd love to meet you! :)


WHAT YOU WILL DO

- Architect, build and maintain systems responsible for financial exam reporting which directly integrate with blockchain technology;
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define and implement elegant solutions, ensuring alignment with best practices and the company’s overarching strategy;
- Integrate with blockchain technologies and protocols, emphasizing secure connections, data flow, and adaptability to the evolving needs of the business;
- Continuously stay updated with the latest trends in backend and blockchain development, ensuring Bastion is using optimal technology;
- Establish a scalable architecture to support current business needs, while remaining adaptable to future customer demands and market trends;
- At least 4 hrs overlap with EST is required.

MUST HAVES

- 5+ years of professional backend engineering experience ;
- Strong coding skills in core backend languages (e.g., Python, Scala, Go, or TypeScript );
- Experience with databases such as Snowflake and Postgres ;
- Proven ability to build compliance tooling in fast-paced environments, especially in fintech or blockchain;
- Solid understanding of regulatory frameworks (e.g., AML, KYC, GDPR ) and their impact on tech and ops;
- Experience working with cross-functional teams (product, legal, risk, ops) to ship compliance-focused solutions;
- Ability to turn complex compliance requirements into scalable, robust backend systems;
- Customer-centric approach and strong execution mindset;
- Upper-Intermediate English level.

NICE TO HAVES

- Prior experience in the blockchain space, especially involving cross-border payments or financial reporting;
- Familiarity with blockchain protocols and integrations;
- Background working in growth-stage startups or on zero-to-one initiatives.

THE BENEFITS OF JOINING US

- Professional growth: Accelerate your professional journey with mentorship, TechTalks, and personalized growth roadmaps.

- Competitive compensation: We match your ever-growing skills, talent, and contributions with competitive USD-based compensation and budgets for education, fitness, and team activities.

- A selection of exciting projects: Join projects with modern solutions development and top-tier clients that include Fortune 500 enterprises and leading product brands.

- Flextime: Tailor your schedule for an optimal work-life balance, by having the options of working from home and going to the office – whatever makes you the happiest and most productive.

title: Geoscience Consultant
description:
Join to apply for the Geoscience Consultant role at Aspen Technology

Join to apply for the Geoscience Consultant role at Aspen Technology

Direct message the job poster from Aspen Technology

Human Resource Professional & Talent Consultant

The driving force behind our success has always been the people of AspenTech. What drives us, is our aspiration, our desire and ambition to keep pushing the envelope, overcoming any hurdle, challenging the status quo to continually find a better way. You will experience these qualities of passion, pride and aspiration in many ways — from a rich set of career development programs to support of community service projects to social events that foster fun and relationship building across our global community.

The Role

AspenTech is an AI-powered software company helping the world’s leading energy, chemical and engineering companies succeed in their digital transformation, making their operations more efficient and reducing impact on the environment. At AspenTech, you will be part of a global market-leading company with double digit growth and a blue-chip customer base.

We offer the opportunity to make an impact, to drive innovation and to be an agent of positive change. Our culture and vision have taken dramatic leaps forward over the past two years and we still have work to do. We need extraordinary individuals to pave the way ahead. The reviews on here paint many stories of successes, failures, excitement and disappointment. Every person has their own story. We strive to make your story at AspenTech a great one.

Provide onsite and remote seismic processing and imaging services to an Oil & Gas client company, helping them achieve and enhance their seismic imaging objectives using advanced processing and imaging technology. The candidate will conduct project work on behalf of that client.

Your Impact

  • Supports clients locally by working collaboratively to solve complex seismic processing issues with state-of-the art software, properly using company resources, company processes and systems for project management, project execution, and project reporting. Sees projects to completion with high levels of customer satisfaction.
  • Works with customer and Aspen Technologies senior team technical members to solve advanced problems collaboratively. Works with depth imaging team members to ensure that the seismic data preparation and conditioning is suitable for velocity model building and depth imaging objectives.
  • Meets regularly with users who are decision makers or who have high influence and communicates findings to Aspen Technologies management to ensure project objectives are being met. Delivers monthly activity report including a list of users contacted and project progress. Actively monitors adherence to contractual obligations including billing and communicates potential gaps to management. Delivers accurate and timely project reports.
  • Initiates, validates, and publishes weekly project reports.
  • Serves as subject matter expert to execute projects to a successful and on-time outcome.

What You'll Need

  • Bs in Geophysics preferably or Geosciences + Post Graduation in Geophysics in lieu of experience.
  • 3 - 5 years’ experience in offshore seismic processing, velocity modeling, and imaging.
  • Experience with narrow, multi-azimuth, wide azimuth, and Ocean Bottom Nodal seismic data.
  • Experience with Aspen Technologies Seismic Processing Software (Echo and GeoDepth) or equivalent.
  • May require a minimum amount of travel.
  • Advanced communication skills in English (verbal and written).
  • Project Management and Organizational skills.

title: Gerente de Projetos - Presencial Rio de Janeiro
description:
Gerente de Projetos - Presencial Rio de Janeiro

Job type: Full-time employee

DESCRIÇÃO DA VAGA

Estamos à procura de profissionais que tenham muita vontade de inovar e colaborar com o crescimento da Every.

Somos uma empresa sólida de Cybersecurity, GRC e Privacy, com foco no cliente, liderança visionária, time colaborativo e excelente clima organizacional! Vem #SerFeliz na Every!

RESPONSABILIDADES E ATRIBUIÇÕES
  • Gerenciar a entrega de projetos grandes e complexos usando estruturas apropriadas e colaborando com patrocinadores para gerenciar escopo e riscos.
  • Impulsionar a lucratividade e o sucesso contínuo gerenciando a qualidade e o custo do serviço e liderando a entrega.
  • Gerenciar e acompanhar as atividades do serviço prestado, garantindo a qualidade do atendimento.
  • Participar e/ou conduzir reuniões com o cliente;
  • Realizar o planejamento de projetos de segurança da informação com adoção de melhores práticas.
  • Tomar decisões relacionadas às definições do projeto e soluções de problemas;
  • Gerenciar o cumprimento de prazos, custos e qualidade das entregas, envolvendo as demais áreas da empresa;
  • Identificar, documentar, gerenciar e solucionar problemas relacionados aos projetos;
  • Gerenciar expectativas e conflitos tanto no ambiente do cliente quanto interno, buscando o melhor custo-benefício;
  • Monitorar projetos, elaborar relatórios e analisar rentabilidade e produtividade;
  • Identificar oportunidades de melhorias em processos e produtos de segurança da informação;
  • Utilizar ferramentas e plataformas disponibilizadas para execução das atividades;
  • Garantir o sucesso do projeto desde o planejamento até a entrega;
  • Coordenar times em múltiplas frentes de negócios, estabelecendo metas, motivando, corrigindo e promovendo o crescimento do time;
  • Orientar e supervisionar a equipe na execução de suas atividades;
  • Fazer interface com os gestores do cliente;
  • Controlar cronogramas e garantir a emissão de documentos conforme a Metodologia de Gestão de Projetos do cliente;
  • Sugerir melhorias nos processos e métodos de trabalho;
  • Realizar controle de qualidade das entregas e produtos do contrato.
REQUISITOS E QUALIFICAÇÕES

Necessário:

  • Nível superior completo, preferencialmente em tecnologia;
  • Pós-graduação em gestão de projetos (desejável);
  • Experiência comprovada em gestão de projetos de TI, de curta e longa duração;
  • Conhecimento em Segurança da Informação e GRC (desejável);
  • Conhecimento em metodologias ágeis, Project, ITIL, COBIT, ISO 27001 e ISO 27701 (desejável);
  • Inglês intermediário/avançado (desejável);
  • Certificação PMP vigente (desejável);

Local de trabalho: Presencial no Rio de Janeiro - RJ.

Benefícios: Horário de trabalho flexível, benefícios acima da média.

Nosso valor é transformar sonhos pessoais e corporativos em realidade. Faça parte da Every!

Sobre a empresa

A Every Cybersecurity, GRC e Privacy Solutions é uma empresa sólida de Segurança da Informação, com foco em GRC e Privacidade de Dados. Atuamos nacionalmente, com foco no cliente, liderança visionária, time colaborativo e excelente clima organizacional. Possuímos certificações ISO 27001:2022 e ISO 27701:2019.

Nosso propósito

A Satisfação dos Clientes em 1º Lugar é nossa prioridade. Buscamos fazer a diferença na vida de nossos colaboradores, clientes, parceiros e sociedade, promovendo uma gestão de riscos eficiente e uma sociedade mais segura e feliz. Desenvolvemos talentos e criamos experiências positivas para todos que se conectam conosco.

O que você pode esperar na Every
  • Participar de projetos variados, com times multidisciplinares e inovadores;
  • Aprender e se reinventar constantemente;
  • Atuar em um ambiente inovador e agradável;
  • Colaborar com profissionais e lideranças inspiradoras;
  • Fazer parte de uma das melhores empresas para trabalhar no Brasil;
  • Ser você mesmo, sem distinções de raça, credo, deficiência, gênero ou orientação sexual.
Benefícios adicionais
  • Plano de saúde e odontológico Bradesco (totalmente cobertos pela empresa);
  • Vale Transporte (sem desconto);
  • Vale Alimentação/Refeição (Cartão CAJU);
  • Day Off no mês do seu aniversário;
  • Convênios com restaurantes próximos ao escritório.
Infraestrutura e cultura

Oferecemos um espaço de convivência com televisão, micro-ondas, forno e sofá para descanso. Nosso escritório é inspirador, promovendo criatividade e produtividade. A liderança é próxima e parceira, com o CEO e a diretoria frequentemente atuando ao seu lado.

title: Arquiteto de Software / Líder Técnico
description:
Join to apply for the Arquiteto de Software / Líder Técnico role at Vertigo Tecnologia

Join to apply for the Arquiteto de Software / Líder Técnico role at Vertigo Tecnologia

Descrição da vaga

Nosso time é composto por pessoas inquietas com foco no resultado e que se interessem pelo ambiente de transformação e inovação digital .

Aqui na Vertigo Tecnologia ajudamos a melhorar a vida dos nossos clientes e dos cidadãos como um todo.

Procuramos por uma Arquiteto de Software/Líder Técnico que queira se desenvolver com a Vertigo!

#GoVertigo

Responsabilidades e atribuições

  • Definir, projetar, desenhar e documentar a Arquitetura das aplicações/projetos;
  • Implementar POC's, criar implementações de referência para os times;
  • Realizar a criação dos ambientes utilizando técnicas de GitOps e Infraestrutura como código (através do uso de ferramentas como Terraform e pipilines Gitlab/Jenkins);
  • Realizar a avaliação/aprovação de código, a partir de merge requests solicitados pelo time.
  • Realizar a liderança técnica de projetos, através de atividades como: mentoria do time técnico; apoio na resolução de dificuldades e problemas técnicos, realização e condução de reuniões técnicas com o cliente, apoio ao gestor do projeto no planejamento de atividades, validação de planejamentos e garantir a aderência dos projetos aos requisitos de compliance dos clientes;
  • Participar ativamente das cerimônias Scrum/Agile dos projetos;
  • Implementar ferramentas e práticas de Automação de testes;
  • Implementar ferramentas e práticas de Qualidade de software nos projetos;
  • Implementar ferramentas e práticas de Segurança (SAST/DAST) nos projetos.

Requisitos e qualificações

  • Graduação completa na área de Tecnologia da Informação;
  • Experiência de pelo menos 5 anos Arquitetura de Aplicações (baseadas em Java);
  • Experiência de pelo menos 2 anos com provedores de nuvem (AWS, Azure);
  • Experiência de pelo menos 2 anos com Modelo arquitetural de micro serviços (API's, ApiOps, GitOps, containers, Docker, docker compose, kubernetes, frameworks java cloudnative - SpringBoot/Quarkus/GraalVm...);
  • Experiência de pelo menos 1 ano com ferramentas e práticas de DevSecOps (Terraform/CloudFormation, pipelines GitLab/Jenkins, Docker, docker compose, Kubernetes, Helm, Istio, SonarQube, Snyk...);
  • Experiência com Bancos de dados SQL Server, MySQL e Postgresql;
  • Experiência com Java (SpringBoot/Quarkus);
  • Experiência com Sistema Operacional Linux;
  • Inglês técnico.

Diferenciais

  • Experiência em plataformas como: Kong, HashiCorp Vault, OpenShift, Istio;
  • Pós-graduação ou Certificação na área de Arquitetura (de Software, Soluções ou Corporativa);
  • Pós-graduação, Certificação ou Experiência profissional na área de Segurança.

Você quer fazer parte do nosso time?

Se inscreva, e embarque nessa jornada com a gente!

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
Grupo Transfero é uma empresa internacional com sede em Zug, Suíça, no coração do Crypto Valley. Nosso propósito é facilitar e promover o acesso e a adoção de ativos digitais, viabilizando uma transição segura para um sistema financeiro global mais descentralizado, baseado na liberdade e autonomia.

Oferecemos soluções privadas baseadas na tecnologia blockchain. Acreditamos na ruptura dos mercados tradicionais e atendemos clientes que desejam acessar essa nova classe de ativos, proporcionando uma experiência exclusiva para clientes individuais e institucionais.

Buscamos um(a) parceiro(a) para atuar no suporte ao time de Tecnologia , exercendo o papel de prestador de serviços em Desenvolvimento Backend .

Descrição das atividades:
  • Desenvolvimento de serviços e sistemas de alta disponibilidade em .Net C#.
  • Manutenção e monitoramento do desempenho das aplicações, identificando melhorias e resolvendo problemas.
  • Apoio na definição de soluções técnicas para novos projetos, contribuindo com sugestões e abordagens práticas.
  • Elaboração e atualização de documentação sobre novas funcionalidades e mudanças realizadas, garantindo clareza e facilidade de manutenção.
Requisitos do prestador de serviços:
  • Sólida experiência com desenvolvimento de software em .Net C#.
  • Conhecimentos sólidos sobre algoritmos e estruturas de dados.
  • Conhecimentos sobre padrões de projetos (Design Patterns) e SOLID.
  • Experiência com testes de unidade e integração.
  • Conhecimentos de Docker e conteinerização.
  • Capacidade de produzir código limpo e de fácil manutenção.
Benefícios oferecidos:
  • Gympass e TotalPass para saúde e bem-estar.
  • Day Off de Aniversário.
  • Plano de saúde por adesão, após 3 meses de ingresso, com condições especiais para planos Bradesco Saúde.

Interessados na parceria podem se inscrever para integrar o projeto inovador da Transfero!

Sobre a Transfero

Ajudamos empresas globais a acessarem oportunidades no mercado latino-americano de forma integrada e sem burocracia, conectando sistemas bancários, criptográficos e financeiros, fornecendo infraestrutura para serviços financeiros a clientes individuais e institucionais.

Buscamos pessoas que queiram fazer parte da evolução do mercado de criptoativos, promovendo liberdade e autonomia financeira, com uma cultura de inovação e colaboração.

Nossa Missão

Conectar países emergentes ao mercado global através de soluções financeiras baseadas em blockchain, promovendo eficiência, flexibilidade e acesso.

Nossa Visão

Ser reconhecida como a empresa de serviços financeiros que melhor conecta países da América Latina com mercados globais, através de plataformas de pagamentos, stablecoins e produtos financeiros tokenizados.

Valores e cultura
  • Seja ousado, proponha desafios e adapte-se às mudanças.
  • Participe ativamente, entregue resultados e tenha visão de longo prazo.
  • Valorize a empatia e o entendimento das necessidades do cliente e da empresa.
  • Mantenha-se atualizado e aberto a novas ideias.
  • Seja confiável e construa parcerias baseadas na reciprocidade.
Conheça nossos benefícios:
  • iFood Card: VA/VR para suas preferências.
  • Gympass ou TotalPass para saúde e bem-estar.
  • Day Off de Aniversário.
  • Plano de saúde por adesão, após 3 meses, com condições especiais.

title: Level Designer
description:
Join to apply for the Level Designer role at Memory Ware .

At Memory Ware, we build games that value narrative depth, mechanical clarity, and emotional resonance.

Our levels are spaces that tell stories, hold tension, and guide players through meaningful interactions. We're seeking a Level Designer to craft expressive, system-aware environments for our JRPG-inspired projects, including exploration maps, combat encounters, and narrative set-pieces, with a focus on pacing, player flow, and readability.

As a Level Designer, you'll collaborate with game designers, writers, artists, and engineers to bring the game world to life. Your responsibilities include defining the rhythm, structure, and gameplay potential of exploration spaces, ensuring each area feels purposeful and enhances the player experience.

What You'll Do:
  1. Block out exterior and interior 3D spaces for optimal layout, flow, sightlines, and gameplay.
  2. Develop engaging levels that integrate gameplay mechanics with narrative elements, aligning with core game principles.
  3. Collaborate with Art and Narrative teams to ensure a cohesive experience.
  4. Participate in discussions to ensure levels meet quality and pacing expectations.
  5. Use level design tools, especially Unity, to create and iterate level layouts.
  6. Balance creative goals with project constraints like timelines and technical limitations.
  7. Produce detailed documentation for game levels to guide the team.
What We're Looking For:
  • Experience designing exploration, narrative, or tactical game levels.
  • Strong sense of space, flow, guidance, and pacing.
  • Proficiency in Unity for prototyping and iteration.
  • Empathy for player experience, especially in exploration and storytelling.
  • Familiarity with JRPG structures, such as dungeon design and pacing.
Bonus Points:
  • Experience designing turn-based combat spaces.
  • Knowledge of environmental storytelling, visual composition, and spatial narrative.
  • Technical skills in camera scripting, triggers, or modular workflows.
  • Passion for games blending mechanical depth with emotional storytelling.
How to Apply:

Email your resume and portfolio to "******" with the subject "Level Designer- Your Name". Feel free to share any personal details you'd like us to know.

About Memory Ware:

Memory Ware is a fully remote, self-funded studio founded in 2024, dedicated to creating player-first JRPGs that tell compelling stories and craft lasting memories. We're developing a new JRPG project and value a healthy, fun work environment with a highly experienced team.
